channel.title: NPR Topics: Culture
channel.description: Art and entertainment commentary plus interviews, book reviews, movie reviews, music reviews, comedy, and visual art. Subscribe to podcasts and follow trends in music, painting, art, architecture, photography, and design.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Mariah Carey, coffee makers and other highlights from the Olympic opening ceremony
item.description: NPR reporters at the Milan opening ceremony layered up and took notes.
item.content:encoded:
NPR reporters at the Milan opening ceremony layered up and took notes.

(Image credit: Sarah Stier)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: Melinda French Gates on learning to trust again after divorcing Bill Gates
item.description: On Wild Card, well-known guests answer the kinds of questions we often think about but don't talk about. Melinda French Gates talks about learning to trust again after her divorce.
item.content:encoded: On Wild Card, well-known guests answer the kinds of questions we often think about but don't talk about. Melinda French Gates talks about learning to trust again after her divorce.
item.dc:creator: Rachel Martin

item.title: Hyperpop, poetry, BDSM or a Moroccan rave allegory? Choose your own cinematic adventure
item.description: Charli xcx is on more screens this weekend while Pillion tells a sweet BDSM story.
item.content:encoded:
Charli xcx is on more screens this weekend while Pillion tells a sweet BDSM story.

(Image credit: A24)
item.dc:creator: Bob Mondello

item.title: 'Pillion' is a wildly entertaining dark comedy about sex and power
item.description: A mild-mannered young man enters into a dominant-submissive relationship with the leader of a gay biker gang. Pillion approaches the subject without judgment and with a great deal of sly humor.
item.content:encoded: A mild-mannered young man enters into a dominant-submissive relationship with the leader of a gay biker gang. Pillion approaches the subject without judgment and with a great deal of sly humor.
item.dc:creator: Justin Chang

item.title: Celebrating 'Taxi Driver' at 50, with Martin Scorsese, Jodie Foster and more
item.description: We celebrate the Oscar-winning 1976 film by listening back to archival interviews with Scorsese, screenwriter Paul Schrader, and actors Jodie Foster, Harvey Keitel, Cybill Shepherd and Albert Brooks.
item.content:encoded: We celebrate the Oscar-winning 1976 film by listening back to archival interviews with Scorsese, screenwriter Paul Schrader, and actors Jodie Foster, Harvey Keitel, Cybill Shepherd and Albert Brooks.
item.dc:creator: Terry Gross

item.title: From Jesus to Jurassic Park: This year's Super Bowl ads are playing it safe
item.description: Early Super Bowl spots show advertisers want lots of buzz but not controversy.
item.content:encoded:
Early Super Bowl spots show advertisers want lots of buzz but not controversy.

(Image credit: Uber Eats)
item.dc:creator: Eric Deggans

item.title: 'A party and a protest': What to expect from Bad Bunny on Super Bowl Sunday
item.description: Petra River-Rideau, co-author of the Bad Bunny Syllabus and the new book P FKN R, says the Puerto Rican artist often wields joy as resistance.
item.content:encoded:
Petra River-Rideau, co-author of the Bad Bunny Syllabus and the new book P FKN R, says the Puerto Rican artist often wields joy as resistance.

(Image credit: Mike Coppola/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Adriana Gallardo

item.title: The U.S. leads on day one of the figure skating team event. Here's how it works
item.description: The three-day event is a chance for the top 10 skating countries to bring home a medal — and for viewers to get acquainted with the sport's different disciplines and biggest names.
item.content:encoded:
The three-day event is a chance for the top 10 skating countries to bring home a medal — and for viewers to get acquainted with the sport's different disciplines and biggest names.

(Image credit: Matthew Stockman)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: A 'Jane Doe' in the R. Kelly trials is ready to share her real name. And her story
item.description: A once anonymous R. Kelly survivor, Reshona Landfair is now ready to reclaim her voice.
item.content:encoded:
A once anonymous R. Kelly survivor, Reshona Landfair is now ready to reclaim her voice.

(Image credit: Grand Central Publishing)
item.dc:creator: Juana Summers

item.title: Their film was shot in secret and smuggled out of Iran. It won an award at Sundance
item.description: Between war, protests and government crackdowns, the filmmakers raced to finish and smuggle their portrait of Tehran's underground arts scene to the prestigious film festival.
item.content:encoded:
at the Sundance Film Festival.'/>

Between war, protests and government crackdowns, the filmmakers raced to finish and smuggle their portrait of Tehran's underground arts scene to the prestigious film festival.

(Image credit: Mandalit del Barco)
